text: More bugs reported in the community forum.
can you link me to it?

I am losing my mind :slightly_smiling_face: Hubl is killing me today,
I wonder what am I doing wrong. Already found a bug on the number field and a few more regarding the default values. Default values are only loaded in the THEME is they are in the 1srt level root of the json field files. Otherwhise you need to go the each ground and subgroup and change the value. Only after you save the value is loaded. Now after that the CSS engine is not redering the HUBL code. It is loading it raw.
In the preview window it looks like this because of the DEFAULT values not be working.
and in the global module editor the code is not converted to CSS:
maybe try appending a string filter before you concatenate it... |string ~ 'px'
oh actually the concatenate symbol is `~`
<@ULLFFHHME> you can't use HubL in the CSS/JS windows
That one is fixed :slightly_smiling_face: sorry other platforms allow. My bad.

Hey all,

Quick question - ive a module that is making use of a logo field. It defaults to the the site logo but I cant seem to figure out how to override it using hubl when I am placing the module.

The field itself is called header_logo but I cant seem to get the source to set. The code below isnt doing the trick neither is omitting the “header_logo” part.

What am I doing wrong?
```   {% module "Desktop Header" path=<path>,
      label="SC - Desktop Header",
      main_nav={{ main_nav }},
      courtesy_nav={{ courtesy_nav }},
      header_logo.override_inherited_src=true,
      header_logo.src={{ logo_src }}
   %}```
